page.title: 04Fells,High Lorton/Whinlatter
page.content: There are seven{fells}in this block;most of them are less than 1600 feet,which is{not very high.}Some are steep,but most go gently upwards.All of them are{good for walking on}and have{views}from the top of Lorton Valley or Whinlatter Pass.The{highest is{Broom Fell}at{1670'.}Brown How is 1650',Todd Fell is 1600',Aiken is 1500',Graystones is 1470',Kirkfell is 1450' and Harrot is 950'. The fells are joined together in {chains,}with dips,called a{hause, between them.The tops are{grassy}and the sides covered in{bracken}and {heather,}although there are some {scree-slopes}on Whinlatter. (Scree is small pieces of broken rock). The{fell-bottoms}are enclosed for {pasture}or{hay-fields,}but higher up they are used to{graze sheep,}except where there are{forestry plantations.
